title: SYNTHEMPATHY: A Scalable Empathy Corpus Generated Using LLMs Without Any Crowdsourcing
author: Run Chen (Columbia University), Jun Shin (Columbia University), Julia Hirschberg (Columbia University), ...
relevance_why: The methodologies used for generating empathetic dialogues and the corpus construction framework can inform approaches for audio-language modeling, particularly in understanding user sentiment and enhancing conversational agents.
background: The task is to create a large-scale corpus of empathetic dialogues generated through a systematic process leveraging Large Language Models (LLMs), without relying on resource-intensive crowdsourcing.
contribution: This paper introduces a novel framework for building an empathy corpus without crowdsourcing, generating 105,578 empathetic dialogue pairs from real-life scenarios.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous empathy corpora primarily utilized crowdsourcing, which limited their scalability and diversity.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work employs LLMs for idea generation and empathetic response crafting, significantly improving scalability and reducing reliance on human labor.

key_innovation: The approach creatively combines story brainstorming, explanation rewriting, and response generation using multiple LLMs, enabling the creation of a diverse and comprehensive empathy dataset.
real_world_impact: The SYNTHEMPATHY corpus can enhance the development of more empathetic AI systems, potentially improving mental health applications and customer service dialogues that require understanding and compassion.
limitations: The model's reliance on electricity consumption for LLM inference may raise concerns about sustainability and accessibility.

new_terms.Chain of Empathy (CoE): **Chain of Empathy** refers to a structured prompting technique used to elicit empathetic responses by incorporating therapeutic frameworks in dialogue generation.

open_sourcing: The code and dataset will be made publicly available upon release of the final version of this paper.
